flavor: Spirit of Hermes, grant me this small favor.

When you are about to suffer Knockdown, roll a d10

name: Labyrinthization
flavor: Leaving a siren shell in a highly mazed environment leads it to take on the characteristics of Temenos. It's quite brittle though.

name: Labyrinth Mauler

name: Puzzle Axe
flavor: It's like a riddle, more powerful with each uncovered piece.

flavor: A cornucopia of useful concoctions, acids and elixirs, most of them deadly.

name: Stepping Stone

name: Isokratos Limiter

name: Asklepios Node

When you are about to involuntarily, permanently lose a Weapon, you may lose this card instead

name: Covenant
flavor: A bond of brotherhood, forged not in iron or blood, but in trust.

name: Temple Camo

name: Stone Relief Armor

name: Great Breaker

name: Relief Cestus
flavor: Dead gods can leave a lasting impression.

name: Control Module

name: Heavy Spear
flavor: Poorly balanced, but still deadly, modelled by Spartans on an old Hyperborean design.

name: Spartan Kopis
flavor: Sparta seemingly renounced all gods, yet its seat of power is called a Temple.

name: Gastraphetes

name: Cyclopean Khopesh

name: Cyclopean Linothorax
flavor: With a few modifications this ancient armor fits a Titan like a glove.

name: Cyclopean Knives
flavor: An excavated ceremonial weapon, from the Cyclope's barbaric period.

name: Cyclopean Visor
flavor: Knowledge without hope breeds only fatalism and indolence.

If you guessed correctly, leave the card on top
If you didn't, gain DangerIcon equal to this BP's level and put it at the bottom of the deck

name: Cyclopean Totem
flavor: It is said the Cyclopes were cursed with the knowledge of the moment of their own death.
